publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3769 Marilyn Livingstone: Town Centre Development—That the Parliament recognises the importance of town centres as a site of local economic and social activity and the key role that they play in Scotland’s economic future; believes that town centres must be supported during the current economic downturn; notes with concern the closure of many establishments key to town centre economic activity in Kirkcaldy and the need for town centre regeneration in Burntisland and Kinghorn, and recognises the need to work with public and private stakeholders to improve town centres across Scotland.
S3M-3769 Town Centre Development (lodged on 23 March 2009) Jamie Hepburn*
S3M-3769 Town Centre Development (lodged on 23 March 2009) Karen Whitefield*
S3M-3769 Town Centre Development (lodged on 23 March 2009) Irene Oldfather*

S3M-3769 Marilyn Livingstone: Town Centre Development—That the Parliament recognises the importance of town centres as a site of local economic and social activity and the key role that they play in Scotland’s economic future; believes that town centres must be supported during the current economic downturn; notes with concern the closure of many establishments key to town centre economic activity in Kirkcaldy and the need for town centre regeneration in Burntisland and Kinghorn, and recognises the need to work with public and private stakeholders to improve town centres across Scotland. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, Karen Whitefield, Irene Oldfather, Sarah Boyack*

S3M-3769 Town Centre Development (lodged on 23 March 2009) Sandra White*, Jim Tolson*, Elaine Smith*, Gil Paterson*, John Park*, Elaine Murray*, Mary Mulligan*, Des McNulty*, James Kelly*, Robin Harper*, Trish Godman*, Kenneth Gibson*, Margaret Curran*, Robert Brown*, Rhona Brankin*
